Package appointmentmaker

Class AppointmentHelpers

java.lang.Object
appointmentmaker.AppointmentHelpers
public class AppointmentHelpers extends Object
This class contains functions designed to abstract the functionality of creating, modifying, deleting, and viewing appointments.

    • appointmentTableColumnName

      public String appointmentTableColumnName(String attribute)
      This function formats all columns for the appointment table into a more user-friendly format without all the underscores. Any single word attributes are just passed along directly.

      Lambda function in switch statement added to reduce the size of the switch statement.

      Parameters:
      attribute - the unform
      Returns:
      the formatted column name

    • getAppointments

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.collections.ObservableList> getAppointments(char time)
      This function finds all appointments within a given range, and returns all of those appointments in a list.

      When time is 'w', the range is 7 days. When time is 'm', the range is 31 days. When the time is 'a', it returns all appointments.

      Parameters:
      time - a char that allows the user to select a week or month time frame denoted by 'w' for week or 'm' for month or 'a' for all
      Returns:
      an ObservableList of all the appointments within the specified range

    • getAppointment

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getAppointment(int id)
      This function gets an appointment from the server and populates the data into an ObservableList for the update appointment screen
      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the appointment being retrieved
      Returns:
      an ObservableList containing all the appointment's data

    • validateAppointment

      public boolean validateAppointment(String currentUser, String apptID, String title, String desc, String loc, String contact, String type, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker sDate, String sTHour, String sTMinute, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker eDate, String eTHour, String eTMinute, String csr, String user, javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      This function validates that the data entered into the add appointment page is valid.

      Its validity is verified by confirming that the user and customer exist, that the appointment is during office hours, and that the appointment doesn't overlap with any other appointment.

      Lambda used for closing the dialog window helps reduce the number of lines and complexity of the code.

      Parameters:
      currentUser - the current user logged in
      apptID - the unique appointment id
      title - the name of the appointment
      desc - appointment description
      loc - appointment location
      contact - the appointment contact person
      type - the type of appointment
      sDate - the day the appointment starts
      sTHour - the hour the appointment starts
      sTMinute - the minute the appointment starts
      eDate - the day the appointment ends
      eTHour - the hour the appointment ends
      eTMinute - the minute the appointment ends
      csr - the customer
      user - the user meeting with the customer
      primaryStage - the primary stage of the project
      Returns:
      returns true if validation was successful, false if there was an error

    • validateAppointment

      public boolean validateAppointment(String currentUser, String apptID, String title, String desc, String loc, String contact, String type, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker sDate, String sTHour, String sTMinute, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker eDate, String eTHour, String eTMinute, String csr, String user, String createdBy, String creationDate, javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      This function validates that the data entered into the update appointment page is valid.

      Its validity is verified by confirming that the user and customer exist, that the appointment is during office hours, and that the appointment doesn't overlap with any other appointment.

      This function explicitly notes the original appointment creator and creation date instead of assigning the current user as the creator and the current date as the creation date.

      Lambda used for closing the dialog window helps reduce the number of lines and complexity of the code.

      Parameters:
      currentUser - the current user logged in
      apptID - the unique appointment id
      title - the name of the appointment
      desc - appointment description
      loc - appointment location
      contact - the appointment contact person
      type - the type of appointment
      sDate - the day the appointment starts
      sTHour - the hour the appointment starts
      sTMinute - the minute the appointment starts
      eDate - the day the appointment ends
      eTHour - the hour the appointment ends
      eTMinute - the minute the appointment ends
      csr - the customer
      user - the user meeting with the customer
      createdBy - the user who created the appointment
      creationDate - the day the appointment was first created
      primaryStage - the primary stage of the project
      Returns:
      returns true if validation was sucessful, false if there was an error

    • duringOfficeHours

      public boolean duringOfficeHours(String startTime, String endTime)
      Checks if the appointment ends by the end of the day.
      Parameters:
      startTime - the starting time of the appointment
      endTime - the ending time of the appointment
      Returns:
      returns true if the appointment is during office hours, and false if the appointment goes past the end of the day

    • deleteAppointment

      public void deleteAppointment(String id)
      This function deletes the given appointment from the appointment table.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the appointment to be deleted

    • setConnection

      public void setConnection(Connection conn)
      This function sets the connection to the database used by all the other functions
      Parameters:
      conn - the connection to the appointment maker database

    • appointmentNotification

      public void appointmentNotification(String currentUser, javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Creates a notification window for the user if there is an appointment within 15 minutes of the user logging in.

      Lambda used for closing the dialog window helps reduce the number of lines and complexity of the code.

      Parameters:
      currentUser - the current user logged in
      primaryStage - the primary stage of the application
